message.content: {"steps":[{"output":"[KR] 1) 구와 평면의 교선인 원 $C$의 중심과 반지름을 구합니다.","explanation":"구의 방정식과 평면의 방정식을 이용하여 원의 중심과 반지름을 찾습니다."},{"output":"[KR] 2) 평면 $x+2z-5=0$에서 $z=\\frac{5-x}{2}$를 구합니다.","explanation":"평면의 방정식을 정리하여 $z$에 대한 식을 얻습니다."},{"output":"[KR] 3) 이를 구의 방정식에 대입: $x^2+y^2+(\\frac{5-x}{2})^2=6$","explanation":"$z$에 대한 식을 구의 방정식에 대입하여 $x$와 $y$에 대한 방정식을 얻습니다."},{"output":"[KR] 4) 정리하면: $\\frac{5}{4}x^2+y^2-\\frac{5}{2}x+\\frac{25}{4}=6$","explanation":"식을 정리하여 $x$와 $y$에 대한 2차 방정식을 만듭니다."},{"output":"[KR] 5) $x^2+y^2-2x+5=\\frac{24}{5}$","explanation":"식을 더 간단히 정리합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 6) $(x-1)^2+y^2=\\frac{19}{5}$","explanation":"완전제곱식을 이용하여 원의 방정식을 만듭니다."},{"output":"[KR] 7) 원 $C$의 중심: $(1,0,2)$, 반지름: $r=\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}}$","explanation":"원의 중심과 반지름을 구합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 8) 점 $P$의 좌표를 구합니다: $P(1,-\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}},2)$","explanation":"원의 방정식을 이용하여 $y$ 좌표가 최소인 점 $P$를 찾습니다."},{"output":"[KR] 9) 점 $Q$의 좌표: $Q(1,-\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}},0)$","explanation":"점 $P$에서 $xy$ 평면에 내린 수선의 발 $Q$의 좌표를 구합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 10) 임의의 점 $X(x,y,z)$에 대해: $|\\overline{PX}+\\overline{QX}|^2 = (\\sqrt{(x-1)^2+(y+\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}})^2+(z-2)^2} + \\sqrt{(x-1)^2+(y+\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}})^2+z^2})^2$","explanation":"점 $X$에 대해 $|\\overline{PX}+\\overline{QX}|^2$의 식을 세웁니다."},{"output":"[KR] 11) 이 식의 최댓값을 구하면: $|\\overline{PX}+\\overline{QX}|^2_{max} = (r+\\sqrt{r^2+4})^2 = (\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}}+\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}+4})^2$","explanation":"$|\\overline{PX}+\\overline{QX}|^2$의 최댓값을 구합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 12) $a+b\\sqrt{30} = (\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}}+\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}+4})^2 = \\frac{19}{5} + \\frac{39}{5} + 2\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}\\cdot\\frac{39}{5}} = \\frac{58}{5} + 2\\sqrt{\\frac{741}{25}} = \\frac{58}{5} + \\frac{2\\sqrt{741}}{5}$","explanation":"식을 전개하여 $a$와 $b$를 구합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 13) $a = \\frac{58}{5}$, $b = \\frac{2\\sqrt{741}}{5\\sqrt{30}} = \\frac{2\\sqrt{741}}{5\\sqrt{30}} \\cdot \\frac{\\sqrt{30}}{\\sqrt{30}} = \\frac{2\\sqrt{22230}}{150} = \\frac{2\\sqrt{4446}}{30}$","explanation":"$a$와 $b$의 값을 구체적으로 계산합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 14) $10(a+b) = 10(\\frac{58}{5} + \\frac{2\\sqrt{4446}}{30}) = 116 + \\frac{2\\sqrt{4446}}{3}$","explanation":"$10(a+b)$의 값을 계산합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 따라서, $10(a+b) = 116 + \\frac{2\\sqrt{4446}}{3}$입니다.","explanation":"최종적으로 $10(a+b)$의 값을 구합니다."},{"output":"[EN] 1) Find the center and radius of circle $C$, which is the intersection of the sphere and plane.","explanation":"Use the equations of the sphere and plane to find the center and radius of the circle."},{"output":"[EN] 2) From the plane equation $x+2z-5=0$, we get $z=\\frac{5-x}{2}$.","explanation":"Rearrange the plane equation to express $z$ in terms of $x$."},{"output":"[EN] 3) Substitute this into the sphere equation: $x^2+y^2+(\\frac{5-x}{2})^2=6$.","explanation":"Substitute the expression for $z$ into the sphere equation to get an equation in $x$ and $y$."},{"output":"[EN] 4) Simplify: $\\frac{5}{4}x^2+y^2-\\frac{5}{2}x+\\frac{25}{4}=6$.","explanation":"Simplify the equation to form a quadratic equation in $x$ and $y$."},{"output":"[EN] 5) Rearrange: $x^2+y^2-2x+5=\\frac{24}{5}$.","explanation":"Further simplify the equation."},{"output":"[EN] 6) Complete the square: $(x-1)^2+y^2=\\frac{19}{5}$.","explanation":"Complete the square to form the equation of a circle."},{"output":"[EN] 7) Center of circle $C$: $(1,0,2)$, radius: $r=\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}}$.","explanation":"Find the center and radius of the circle."},{"output":"[EN] 8) Find coordinates of point $P$: $P(1,-\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}},2)$.","explanation":"Use the circle equation to find the point $P$ with the minimum $y$-coordinate."},{"output":"[EN] 9) Coordinates of point $Q$: $Q(1,-\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}},0)$.","explanation":"Find the coordinates of point $Q$, the foot of the perpendicular from $P$ to the $xy$-plane."},{"output":"[EN] 10) For any point $X(x,y,z)$ on the circle: $|\\overline{PX}+\\overline{QX}|^2 = (\\sqrt{(x-1)^2+(y+\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}})^2+(z-2)^2} + \\sqrt{(x-1)^2+(y+\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}})^2+z^2})^2$.","explanation":"Set up the expression for $|\\overline{PX}+\\overline{QX}|^2$ for a point $X$ on the circle."},{"output":"[EN] 11) The maximum value of this expression is: $|\\overline{PX}+\\overline{QX}|^2_{max} = (r+\\sqrt{r^2+4})^2 = (\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}}+\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}+4})^2$.","explanation":"Find the maximum value of $|\\overline{PX}+\\overline{QX}|^2$."},{"output":"[EN] 12) $a+b\\sqrt{30} = (\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}}+\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}+4})^2 = \\frac{19}{5} + \\frac{39}{5} + 2\\sqrt{\\frac{19}{5}\\cdot\\frac{39}{5}} = \\frac{58}{5} + 2\\sqrt{\\frac{741}{25}} = \\frac{58}{5} + \\frac{2\\sqrt{741}}{5}$.","explanation":"Expand the expression to find $a$ and $b$."},{"output":"[EN] 13) $a = \\frac{58}{5}$, $b = \\frac{2\\sqrt{741}}{5\\sqrt{30}} = \\frac{2\\sqrt{741}}{5\\sqrt{30}} \\cdot \\frac{\\sqrt{30}}{\\sqrt{30}} = \\frac{2\\sqrt{22230}}{150} = \\frac{2\\sqrt{4446}}{30}$.","explanation":"Calculate the values of $a$ and $b$."},{"output":"[EN] 14) $10(a+b) = 10(\\frac{58}{5} + \\frac{2\\sqrt{4446}}{30}) = 116 + \\frac{2\\sqrt{4446}}{3}$.","explanation":"Calculate the value of $10(a+b)$."},{"output":"[EN] Therefore, $10(a+b) = 116 + \\frac{2\\sqrt{4446}}{3}$.","explanation":"Find the final value of $10(a+b)$. "}],"final_answer":"116 + \\frac{2\\sqrt{4446}}{3}"}
